content: swirly dreamcatcher pattern this is my first pattern so any gentle feedback would be greatly appreciated my ravelry id is cherryliqueur - i d love to see what you make caption a few notes about the pattern i ve always used fingering yarn but you could scale up using a larger hook of course and use larger hoop my lovely husband prints the hoops for me on his 3d printer but you can buy wooden rings fairly reasonably priced online in a variety of sizes i ve written the pattern for 14 row but i sometimes need more sometimes less depending on the stretch of the yarn and the size of the hoop so some judgement is needed try adding beads add them to the yarn before you start and pick them up at appropriate stitches - they look so pretty yarn fingering hook 2mm hoop 8cm diameter round 1 ch4 and join with a slip_stitch to form a loop round 2 ch4 then single_crochet into the loop repeat 4 times round 3 ch4 then 2 single_crochet in the first chain 4 of round 2 ch4 2 single_crochet in the next ch4 from round 2 repeat 4 times round 4 -13 ch4 2sc in next chain 4 of previous round single_crochet in all but the last in each group of single_crochet from previous round eg where there are 3 stitches single_crochet in the first 2 where there are 4 single_crochet in the first 3 etc round 14 attach your crochet to your hoop using a single_crochet stitch all the way around going around the chain stitches and through the tops of the single_crochet stitches finish off leaving a loop to hang your dream catcher weaving in any loose ends finishing cut 16 strands of yarn approximately 30cm in length take 4 strands fold them in half and pull the middle point through your dreamcatcher at the bottom centre opposite the top loop push the ends of the tassel through the middle point and pull tight to secure repeat the process to add 2 further tassels on either side about 4-5cm either side of the centre enjoy
